snippet: Google appears to be emerging from an major antitrust investigation in the United States essentially unscathed. But the outlook is not as bright for Google in Europe.
abstract: Federal Trade Commission appears ready to back off centerpiece of its antitrust case against Google in exchange for smaller, voluntary concessions from company; charge remains central to case against Google in Europe, where anti-competition laws are more widely applied.

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and STEVE LOHR
byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels and Steve Lohr from New York. Claire Cain Miller contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Google appears to be emerging from an major antitrust investigation in the United States essentially unscathed. But the outlook is not as bright for Google in Europe.

headline.main: As Europe Presses Google on Antitrust, U.S. Backs Away
headline.print_headline: Google Deal On Antitrust Seen in U.S.
